website_summaries.verdict: An accurate, portable step counter with all the essential functions but no extra bells and whistles.
cons: String tether can make unit feel "loose" and unsecure
Reset button is highly sensitive and may accidentally erase data

customer_reviews.title: Great pedometer
customer_reviews.text: Bought another pedometer, to use with Weight Watchers program. It was a bust. Accuracy less than 74%, based on 1000 steps registering as 739! Returned it to WalMart and ordered this one from Amazon. Three trials of 1,000 steps yielded 1,000 / 998 / 1001. Pretty good and maybe I miscounted in my control count. Lots of other features that make it well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: B. W. Sheier

customer_reviews.title: As other reviewer(s? ) reported, this item just ...
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewer(s?) reported, this item just adds bizarre numbers of steps at times. It has NO WAY of just turning it off so I can't, for example, powerdown when I'm going someplace in the car. Which sux, because in the last several miles just driving in the car it recorded 30 steps. It has NO WAY to truly delete these steps, apart from a hard reset (pushing the recessed button inback) which deletes ALL saved history.
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: Really good product
customer_reviews.text: This is a really neat little device... It fits in your pocket without notice, and, as advertised, is highly accurate. To set the pedometer up, map a two-to-three-mile course on Google Maps... then walk the course. Keep adjusting the stride length (read the instructions) until the pedometer reads out the same distance as the Google Map. Map a second course, then double check it. The pedometer records distance walked by the day and the week, and holds 52 weeks of past data. BTW: Apple iPhone has an App that is supposed to do all of these things, but (i) is not nearly as accurate, and (ii) is nowhere near as convenient to carry on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: A.P.S.

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases I've ever made here!
customer_reviews.text: I've carried this step-counter daily for over 4 years, and I love it! It's tiny (it easily slips into a pants pocket), surprisingly accurate (I test it every so often by counting my steps), and reliable (I change the battery once a year). Every night at 2 a.m., the step count reverts to zero. I have no interest in anything but my daily step count, and no interest in having my personal data uploaded to Big Brother, so this is perfect. Six stars (at least)!
customer_reviews.author: Philly Girl

customer_reviews.title: Sent this back....immediatley!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was totally impossible to figure out how to set up. Ridiculous!!! Once I got to "set stride" it went to zero and I could not "go back" or figure out how to re-set. This unit should be a "no brainer" to set up. Have you looked at the directions? Really? Going to look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: smwyzard

customer_reviews.title: This is the one to get.
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for 3 weeks. It took about 2 days to get it set right, get used to it, and test it until I was confident in the readings. I'm surprised by how accurate it is. I can bag up the trash, take it outside, put it in the dumpster and my step count is 0. But when I take my morning walk and count 200 steps, it reads 200 steps. It works fine in my shirt pocket but not in my shorts pocket, I guess because I'm so big. I played with the stride length until I got it dead on accurate. I've been very happy with this little gadget and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Im sure its good. But read my review.
customer_reviews.text: Might be good and great. But very difficult to set up. Bought it for a friend who is trying to lose weight. Tracking her steps is very important. She found it was tracking steps when in the car. And tracking steps. She gave up using it and went back to her Weight Watchers Step meter. She feels bad for not using it.
customer_reviews.author: Ray P.

customer_reviews.title: i really loved my old one
customer_reviews.text: i really loved my old one, this one is a little too easy to reset accidentally, however, that said, it has more features, is just as accurate, is slimmer, and easier to read, its easier to set, but again, I tend to absentmindedly fiddle things and reset it so there we go eh? For accuracy counting steps for this fat broad, it doesn't give me more or short me, which most other ones do, and the quality is terrific, If your not a compulsive fidgety type, tuck this bad boy in your pocket and you will love it.
customer_reviews.author: Charnley M.

customer_reviews.title: What I did not like is that it cannot be clipped on to you
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be very accurate. What I did not like is that it cannot be clipped on to you. It has a clip and dangles, it does not have a clip on the back of the unit to clip it securely onto your clothing. It also cannot be turned off or paused. I like to wear it while hiking in the morning, pause it, then start it again for the evening hike but you can't. It records foot steps as it's bouncing around in the car. So make sure to record your distance on each hike!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: The unit is easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: The unit is easy to set up, and once you've got the right stride length, is very accurate in comparison with mechanical pedometers. The large numbers are easy to read at a glance and it does not matter what orientation the unit is in when in your pocket. So far I've used it for several weeks and I have been very pleased. FYI, it does not have a belt clip, so you do need to wear something with pockets. I would recommend the Yamax EX-510 for those who want to accurately track their daily walking routines.
customer_reviews.author: DJ400

customer_reviews.title: I wrote to USA Yamasa re my issue(s) with this ...
customer_reviews.text: I wrote to USA Yamasa re my issue(s) with this pedometer and have not received a response. 1) continually resets on its own, so steps and mileage are incorrect, and 2) instructions vague as to setting stride -- cm or in ? ? Any chance that this venue may warrant an response?
customer_reviews.author: reader of books

customer_reviews.title: Functional and straightforward
customer_reviews.text: I've counted my steps and compared with the pedometer several times and found it to be accurate. It took me a few tries and hitting the reset button over and over but still thought the setup was a breeze. What I did was take measurements in lb/in (what I'm comfortable with) and converted it over to kg/cm (metric) for setup as the EX-510 offers more precise increments in metric. I bought two and one came with a non-working battery. The big display and straightforward functions are what I wanted. If you don't need a heart rate monitor, Caller ID, etc., this is it!
customer_reviews.author: Christina H.

customer_reviews.title: Run with it!
customer_reviews.text: Love my pedometer! It is a part of my daily workout routines. I feel that it's pretty accurate. I have tested it out on several occasions. I would have enjoyed it a little more if display was simpler. I did feel like it had too much going on in terms of the screen and buttons. But overall the best pedometer out there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I put it in a little pouch in my bra and it works fine.
customer_reviews.text: I compared it to the treadmill I use and believe it was accurate as to distance and time walked. As for calories burned, I walk on a 6 % incline and the Yamax doesn't recognize that, but I have checked it several times against the treadmill and it is consistent in the difference between what the treadmill readout says and what the Yamax says. I also checked the distance against my car's odometer, and it was the same. Since I don't have shirt pockets, I put it in a little pouch in my bra and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Noreen

customer_reviews.title: Really great device. My only complaint is that these things ...
customer_reviews.text: Really great device. My only complaint is that these things really should come with a "start/stop" button because testing how far a certain trail walk is would be logical. Like many reviews state, subtract by 10%... However! Know that even with that, this is the most accurate pedometer you can get. It consistently gets the highest review in comparison articles. I bought one for my grandmother too I liked it so much.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Has provided highly useful information for fitness improvement efforts. Some effort was needed to set it up and to learn how to retrieve the stored history data. Well worth the time spent.
customer_reviews.author: CEC

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I researched several pedometers before I purchased this product. I definitely made the right choice! It's a great little item. It's small & compact & is very accurate. It can be used inside a pants pocket & clipped to your belt. I wear mine everyday to keep track of my steps. It's so small that it's never uncomfortable. I have recommended it to 2 of my friends already.
customer_reviews.author: athena15

customer_reviews.title: I there any pedomoter that is accurate?
customer_reviews.text: Not this one. I used to have a wonderful Omron. Have not found a good one since. All I want to do is measure steps!!!
customer_reviews.author: Frank L. Friedman

customer_reviews.title: IT worked as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: It's very good no complaints. More convenient than a pedometer that you have clip-on.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Easy Peasy
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that this thing doesn't have all those bells and whistles, like others do. The last pedometer I threw out, I had only had it 3 days. It sat in the trash cans beeping it's little heart out, because I couldn't figure out how to turn it off! This thing, I just stick it in my front pocket of my jeans in the morning, and forget about it the rest of the day. It does count aerobic exercise and elliptical steps taken. Another plus.
customer_reviews.author: BRENDA ROBINSON

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Pedometer!
customer_reviews.text: I'd purchased and ruined several pedometers over the years. The ones that clip on your belt and go click, click, click as you walk. Then they get ripped off and smack on the ground when you catch them on something. End of pedometer. This one is like magic. Drop it in your pocket in any direction. No click, click, click. It just works! And 30 days worth of data at your fingertips! This is definitely the next generation and then some.
customer_reviews.author: Crilly Butler

customer_reviews.title: 50% satisfaction rate.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought two of these. I bought one and then broke it when I washed it in my clothes washer (left it in pants pocket). The first one was fantastic! After breaking the first one, I bought a second one. The second one was defective. The step counter was inaccurate. When I walked 6 steps, for example, it would say I walked 20 or whatever. It was simply inaccurate. I had to ship that one back. So I had a 50% success rate with these. I did get a full refund, though I had to pay for postage to send back.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Franson

customer_reviews.title: Love this....but keep it dry!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this pedometer for several months and found it to be highly accurate! Sad part is, it got washed in my jeans pocket by mistake! No longer works. Didn't expect it to be water proof - just thought I'd let you know.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanie Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Takes a lickin' and keeps working!!
customer_reviews.text: I just have to say, I love this pedometer but I accidentally left it in my pocket and it went through the washer! I left it out to dry and it still works like a charm! Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: This is my incentive to walk more. I love facts. When I have a device that tells me all the results that this pedometer does, it not only gives me satisfaction but stimulates me to walk even more. Easy to program initially especially after one reads the instructions. It does all I expected and wanted. Buy one....
customer_reviews.author: naturesson

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. I wanted a reliable pedometer and this one works exactly as described onsite.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: I expect it's OK I just haven't had suficient patience ...
customer_reviews.text: I expect it's OK I just haven't had suficient patience to poke at it and the instruction to make it work. Maybe some day all electronic instruments will incorporate some standardization and simplify turn on and operating processes to just one or two lines and ureka!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Young

customer_reviews.title: and fits nicely in my pocket and i hardly know it is ...
customer_reviews.text: This little device is a gem. It is light weight, and fits nicely in my pocket and i hardly know it is there. When I want to check my steps, it is easy to pull out and the large numbers are great! It is simple, and easy to use - just what I had hoped it would be.
customer_reviews.author: m.j.

customer_reviews.title: can only program step length to 3 inch increments, ...
customer_reviews.text: can only program step length to 3 inch increments, such as 21,24,27, etc., so all those inches add up and then total distance will not be correct.
customer_reviews.author: Rex

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes it misses steps but I still walk a LOT more than I used to
customer_reviews.text: When I count, this pedometer definitely doesn't pick up every step (it might miss 5%). This still makes it better than the other pedometers I have used, and more importantly having the thing makes me a LOT more active. It hasn't ever reset accidentally and I have clipped it in a number of different locations. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Buffaloafer

customer_reviews.title: I like it because it's small
customer_reviews.text: I like it because it's small, easy to use and accurate within 10 steps of mine. It works best in the pocket. I wish it would work on the bike but the add did say it was for walking only.
customer_reviews.author: connie

customer_reviews.title: No matter where I carry it, it keeps resetting ...
customer_reviews.text: No matter where I carry it, it keeps resetting itself back to 0 . We are having a contest at work, and I need my steps to turn in everyday, and the most I have seen on it is almost 5000, the next time I looked it had gone back to 0 . frustrated
customer_reviews.author: paula harjo

customer_reviews.title: Great pedometer
customer_reviews.text: This pedometer is the best I've ever had. It's accurate and easy to fit in my pocket. The reason I gave it 4 stars was that I wished it had a normal clip like other pedometers to clip it onto the top of my pants or skirts. There is a clip at the end of a cord that works well with clipping it to the outside of the pocket and making sure that it doesn't fall out. Other than that, it's a great pedometer and I'm glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Great!  Accurate!
customer_reviews.text: Love this pedometer. Once calibrated, you can watch the numbers tick over with every step. I've tried fit bit and jawbone, and other pedometers. None were even close to the accuracy of this Yamax.
customer_reviews.author: S. S.

customer_reviews.title: Failed at 2 1/2 months.  Do not waste your money on this product.
customer_reviews.text: I liked this unit when I first got it. I needed to change the battery after 1 1/2 months. Then, it just stopped working at 2 1/2 months. Do not waste your money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Judy H.

customer_reviews.title: ... walk thousands of miles a year and I am satisfied with the accuracy of this pedometer
customer_reviews.text: I walk thousands of miles a year and I am satisfied with the accuracy of this pedometer. I use it to check my other pedometer and my iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Quinn

customer_reviews.title: ... accurate as it says it is but it has cool features and works everytime I use it unlike another ...
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't say it's as accurate as it says it is but it has cool features and works everytime I use it unlike another brand perimeter I had. Over all I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Riversong

customer_reviews.title: Heat from my body rendered this useless.
customer_reviews.text: Took moments to break. Heat from my body rendered this useless.
customer_reviews.author: The Honest Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Yamax EX-510
customer_reviews.text: Verified that it is accurate counting steps. Accurate distance when stride lenght is accurately input. Used in pants pocket and on neck strap both gave accurate counts. I have used for a month with no issues, the unknown is battery life.
customer_reviews.author: BCRON

customer_reviews.title: Yamax Power Walker
customer_reviews.text: I had heard it was very easy to program and that is the reason I bought it. I did not find it easy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Elinor  Horton

customer_reviews.title: Just couldn't get it to work.
customer_reviews.text: I have followed the instructions to get the accuracy advertised. The last day I used it I wore it for 3 hours while cleaning house. It recorded 139 steps while my iPhone showed nearly 3000. I will stick with the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Over-counts consistently.
customer_reviews.text: Like others have posted, I've found this adds 10% to my steps. Consistently records 110 steps when I pace a counted 100. As long as it's consistent, I know what I've done. Just multiply the result by 0.91 if you want the real count. Otherwise, it's exactly what it says it is.
customer_reviews.author: North Shore

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We feel this product has an accurate distance and step measurement
customer_reviews.author: m loding

customer_reviews.title: Yamax EX-350---
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Had a small issue when I first got the unit. I set the clock in the afternoon without realizing it was a "24 hour" setting, not a 12 hour setting. I emailed the company and the problem was solved with their return email. The unit resets automatically every morning at 2 am. It will therefore show as zero steps when you use it the following day. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Robert States

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS AN EXCELLENT PEDOMETER. VERY ACCURATE
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS AN EXCELLENT PEDOMETER. VERY ACCURATE, HOWEVER, IT IS ALL IN METRIC SO YOU HAVE TO CONVERT TO SEE ANY RESULTS.
customer_reviews.author: ELLY GRACE

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with this product
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this product. Hard to use, print on instructions is very tiny and VERY difficult to read. I do not recommend this product unfortunately because can't figure out how to use it and how it's being used, is very inaccurate.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie D.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product with many features and ways to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product with many features and ways to use. We tried two others and this is so superior. It does everything they say and is very sturdy as well.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Maxin

customer_reviews.title: It's a good product, no problem so far
customer_reviews.text: Made in Japan. Accurate, if you input all your data correctly. It's a good product, no problem so far. Only drawback is that it doesn't clip on strongly enough to pants without pockets. I would recommend always having it clipped AND secured inside a pocket. Still, an excellent product that I enjoy it very much.
customer_reviews.author: T. W.

customer_reviews.title: go big or go home
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the pedometer to track my steps for a 10,000 steps challenge and wanted a good inexpensive one because I didn't know if I would stick to the challenge. Well, its been over a month and the challenge is over and I an still wearing it daily. It is a great little gadget; it tracks your daily steps, and keeps track of 30 days and 30 weekly totals, that's alot of space. Its easy and comfortable to throw in your pocket or clip to any clothing, it doesn't track fake steps and it very accurate. Great item for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: steppin maniac

customer_reviews.title: Use and set up are very confusing!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have found that the instructions are very confusing on its' set and use. It seems to work well. Not sure how to use it so at the present moment it is idle. I will try again when I have more patience. John OBrien
customer_reviews.author: J. OBrien

customer_reviews.title: It is okay. Strap broke after a month of ...
customer_reviews.text: It is okay. Strap broke after a month of using it. Worth the money. Only needed something for a temporary program.
customer_reviews.author: Janine

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate and affordable
customer_reviews.text: I am finding this pedometer to be more accurate than a Fitbit which I recently lost. I measure my walking against a web based site that maps distances and I am getting very accurate measurements from the Yamax EX-510.
customer_reviews.author: Steven G Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: feels sturdy in your hand
customer_reviews.text: Returned my FitBit (POS that couldn't track steps accurately if I bet it $1000!) and got the Yamax after some research for accuracy. And when they say %99 accurate, they mean it. It's well-built, feels sturdy in your hand, and easily fits in your pocket or bra. GREAT product. Highly recommended. Easy to use, easy to look at your history. Superior product.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Second one I have bought and it's very accurate. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Queenbee

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read, accurate! I have checked mileage walking at local track and it was right on. Even went through the wash (accidentally) and kept working! Glad I purchased it!
customer_reviews.author: Terri L. Reed

customer_reviews.title: EX-510 Would buy it again!
customer_reviews.text: This was a stocking stuffer for my wife and she loves it. Easy to set up and she can put it in her pocket or attach it to her belt and off she walks. The safety leash I purchased with it is kind of hokey and unnecessary but it wasn't expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was for my daughter and she's happy with it.. That's all that matters 😊
customer_reviews.author: Teri L

customer_reviews.title: Yamax Ex-510 User Review
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my retired husband has no smartphone and did not want a device that needed to be connected to a computer. Very happy so far easy to use and more accurate than the other pedometer he was using.The only issue is that the device is very slippery therefore extra care needs to be taken when handling it.
customer_reviews.author: sweetgolde

customer_reviews.title: Happy Customer
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this pedometer. It is accurate, easy to use, fits into my pocket easily, and has the added bonus of a clock. I bought it for vacations so I would know how far we walk and was very happy with it my first outing. Highly recommend and the price is good too.
customer_reviews.author: Susan S.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I use this pedometer everyday and slip it into any pocket. Very covnenient and accurate! I couldn't be more pleased. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jay of CA

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a mid range pedometer and this certainly fitted the bill. It was easy to set up with concise instructions. Clear screen with information accessed quickly. It fits easily and safely into a pocket with a strong clip. I use this nearly every day and it is still going strong with only one battery change.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not User Friendly
customer_reviews.text: I found it difficult to operate and I can't clip it to anything while I'm walking. It just didn't work out for me at all.
customer_reviews.author: Char

customer_reviews.title: I like the fact that you can put it in your ...
customer_reviews.text: This product works very well. I like the fact that you can put it in your pocket and don't have to attach it to your waist like some others I have owned. It is great incentive to get up and move, to make sure I get my 10,000 steps in! I like it and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dzima

customer_reviews.title: Not so accurate!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the supposed accuracy of this model/brand. Be advised that it often jumps ten steps at a time. Not pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Evans

customer_reviews.title: I returned it!
customer_reviews.text: I found this: (1) hard to set up (poor instructions included); (2) not convenient (the clip doesn't really work on waistband of pants; and the recommendations given don't work for me: I don't have pockets in my sweats or many of my pants, and I don't carry my purse to put the pedometer in when I'm walking for exercise; (3) not highly accurate (I would test walking the same area in the same number of steps and the pedometer's step count varied greatly!) I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Cortland Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Not what I had hoped it would be.
customer_reviews.text: I find it difficult to set the parameters. Al of my steps are measured in inches and feet this is CM. I was hoping it would be more accurate than the pendulum style pedometers. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Margie

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up. Put in pocket and walk, done. Light weight, small and yet easy to read. All I need is the step counter, but it does a bit more.
customer_reviews.author: William Pritchard

customer_reviews.title: Slim design, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very portable but I seem to keep resetting it if I sit down and it's not an easy thing to reset so I don't know what I'm doing. Would be great if you could lock the reset button or if it had a cover that protected the reset button so that you don't accidentally reset. Nice and slim, easy to slide into a pocket.
customer_reviews.author: deb

customer_reviews.title: Super Accurate!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be accurate 90% of the time. Tried several others that were all over the place bit this one keeps right on the money. Lots of helpful info at the touch of a button.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: pedometer is simple to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this model because it was reviewed as very accurate. It is if the stride length is set right. That is easy to do and a description of how to measure was given. I wanted a simple model, not a gps tracker. This is just right.
customer_reviews.author: Gale Barnett

customer_reviews.title: acurate meter
customer_reviews.text: this is a good pedometer well satfly the reason i give it a 4 stars is that it dose not have a belt clip and need a screen protecter i would recomend this meter as a # 1 product.
customer_reviews.author: Ova Rice

customer_reviews.title: Best pedometer I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best pedometer I have ever owned. Once set you are good to go. When you wake in the morning it is automatically set back to zero to keep track of your steps for the day. I have told friends and family about how good the product is and continue to orders the Yamax E 510 for them. I have owned many pedometers and this is by far the best. LMP
customer_reviews.author: Lucy M Perfette

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It is not accurate at all. It would not track steps. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Gift for my wife!
customer_reviews.text: She loves it. This was bought as a gift. We haven't even tried to see if it's accurate. It seems to be.
customer_reviews.author: kart97

customer_reviews.title: If you do not have a pocket it swings around ...
customer_reviews.text: If you do not have a pocket it swings around since it has no holder. I do not think it is as accurate as the Omron pedometers I have used.
customer_reviews.author: piratecat

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great very accurate except while riding on a motorcycle it tends count many extra steps.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Gilson

customer_reviews.title: Fan of Yanax
customer_reviews.text: I use it daily. The Yamax counts my steps and lets me know how active I am each day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really love this. Small and easily fits into my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Wally

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: I think it is hard to set up especially for a senior
customer_reviews.author: Coco

customer_reviews.title: dubious
customer_reviews.text: this thing adds steps just by getting in and out of my pocket. that sort of info is not helpful.
customer_reviews.author: j mark schmearer

customer_reviews.title: Like the small size
customer_reviews.text: Like the small size. Seems accurate. Others have posted that it is easy to reset by accident which has made me nervous, but so far I haven't experienced that.
customer_reviews.author: DWheels

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: The Yamax is a convenient pedometer. You can put it in your pocket and forget about it. It tracks your steps throughout the day. It also will counts your activity if you are biking etc.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph92

customer_reviews.title: It stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I wore this device while I ran and worked out and moisture got into it. Now him no worky...I owned it for about three months.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Michaels

customer_reviews.title: I would also like a Trip A/Trip B option like a car odometer ...
customer_reviews.text: Provides accurate reading when it works. It has a tendency to (rarely) reset itself during a walk. I would also like a Trip A/Trip B option like a car odometer so I can review individual workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Newton

customer_reviews.title: Great Pedometer
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate. Easy to carry and use. Wish I had bought it ages ago.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought one and love its accuracy! Turned around and bought my significant other one. Light weight, easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.author: from the heart

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: I was unable to set it up. Directions were too much for me.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Pope

customer_reviews.title: Yamax Power Walker EX-510
customer_reviews.text: This unit replaces the one I lost (which was the same model) . It is accurate and easy to use, works extremely well in my pocket. Battery seems to last forever. For my money this is the best model I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Fred C

customer_reviews.title: Loved it so much bought one for my husband also!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I order one for me and one for my husband. We are very happy with the Yamax Power Walker. It does everything it says. Just a reminder to anyone ordering. It uses the 24 hour clock. It doesn't say that in the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: FL/MI Gal

customer_reviews.title: Works great. If calculating daily steps make sure to read ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. If calculating daily steps make sure to read before getting in vehicles. It will add hundreds of steps while in a car.
customer_reviews.author: KBeuke

customer_reviews.title: It works great!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Have used other pedometers over the years and this is a good one. Very easy to set up and is light in the pocket. This one is worth 5 stars......
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Turczynski

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this keeps him motivated and does keep track of steps really well
customer_reviews.author: dudsey

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy with a pedometer is a pipe dream.
customer_reviews.text: A pedometer is never going to give you an accurate reading. However, I purchased a Reebok pedometer and it was wildly off. Just driving to the store or driving my riding lawn mower could count for 1000's of steps. This looked great to my doctor, but I knew. The Yamax that I bought seems a little smarter than the Reebok, not super accurate, but better.
customer_reviews.author: VOFSAR

customer_reviews.title: Great little unit.
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what it claims--it gives you accurate step readings along with distance, etc. I was looking for one I could just put in my pocket and not think about until the end of the day. This worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Deana R. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase, does everything described. Reasonably priced and arrived on time. Once I figured out how to set up. It was a GO.... Not sure if it registers when biking.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. complicated at the beginning but you need to be patient. I use it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Rabe-Culas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent item
customer_reviews.text: Got this item a few weeks ago and it is simple to set up and accurate. My only problem, after I read the information again, it did not clip on.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Tried it and it added steps when I was sitting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Power Walking
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed. Kind of fell of the wagon with walking and got to get at it again. Just need a little help
customer_reviews.author: pati dozier

customer_reviews.title: Does a very nice job at keeping track of my steps
customer_reviews.text: wanted one for a long time, this one is just about all I could wish for. Does a very nice job at keeping track of my steps.
customer_reviews.author: Valeria

product_meta.title: Highly Accurate - 98 to 99% - Yamax Power Walker EX-510
product_meta.description: 3D Accelerometer Sensor filter In order to recognize actual walking activity, 3D sensor has 11 steps filter.If you move less than 11 steps and take about 5 seconds no-motion break, previous 11 or less steps will not be counted. This device can store up to 30 days of memory data and 30 weeks of accumulated weekly data. Each of number of steps, calorie, fat burn, distance walked and activity time are stored in memory at 2:00 am after midnight every day. Accumulated Week Data will be stored from Monday to Sunday up to 30 weeks.
feature_bullets: Japanese design - Works in any position
Features include: steps, distance, stride, calories and fat burned, 30 day memory, and clock
